result.execSummary:
The defendant Simon R. Flores III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Simon R. Flores III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Simon R. Flores III was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

supervisions.notes: Credit for 61 days served, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.
Pay restitution plus surcharges  on file 14-CM-1692, - to be determined at a hearing.  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORRHWITH.  Huber allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Simon R. Flores III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular
For Ct 1 only - Dismissed.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.   Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for one year w/conditions.  Conditions include serving 45 days in Co. Jail with Huber forthwith.  If probation is revoked, def. to receive credit for 61 days served.
character letter to Judge Kerkman, from Alexis Rendon (mother of her & DE's daughter)
to enter no contest plea in exchange for probation (as drafted by DE for files 14cm1692, 15cm649, 15cm247)
Atty:  D Celebre.

*Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.
343.44(1)(b) - OAR/Repeater  946.49(1)(a) - Misd bail jumping/Repeater
Returned on Warrant

138pm
Special Pros Daniel Tombasco appearing for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk JT.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Defendant requests Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Deft does not want counsel for hearing.    jk

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Jeremy Chavez appeared for Defendant, Simon Flores III who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Statements heard on Atty Chavez's motion to withdraw as counsel.  Upon hearing statements motion to withdraw as  counsel is granted by the court and warrant continues.
to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Chavez
in Support of Motion to withdraw as counsel of Attorney Jeremy Chavez.
Of bail/bond forfeiture

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney Jeremy Chavez appeared on behalf of defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Chavez states DE was here prior to court to start of court but ran out of courthouse when he was told he was facing bail jumping charges.  Court authorizes a Bench Warrant with a $5000 Cash Bond and prior bond shall be forfeited.
FPT moved from 6/2/15 to 5/20/15 at 10:00 AM during ADA Drees's week per confirmation with Atty Chavez.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Jeremy Chavez.  Clerk: PT
Atty Chavez states he was just served with revocation paperwork for DE and requests an adjournment for global resolution; no objection by the State.  FPT on 6/2/15 9:40 AM.
Posted $1000 on 3-12-15
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Atty J Chavez

1:52 pm    Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco Defilippis.  Clerk:  LE.  Plea of not guilty entered.  PTC 3-6-15 @ 1:40 & FPT 3-18-15 @ 10:00 with 14CM1692.  $1000 cash bond set with conditions.

*Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.
